call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - July 17th

decisions.decision: 6.0 activation will occur around October based on 90+ percent support
decisions.speaker: kushti
decisions.context: Voting results showing strong community support
decisions.quote: So it seems there is 90 plus percent support. So then we will see 6.0 activation around October.

decisions.decision: Sub-blocks testing will happen after 6.0 activation
decisions.speaker: kushti
decisions.quote: And yeah, we can think about sub-blocks after. So yeah well let's try public testnet first and then consider mainnet activation time frame.

commitments.commitment: Public testnet mining sub-blocks supporting nodes in July
commitments.quote: I think we can do public testnet mining sub-blocks supporting nodes in July.

commitments.commitment: Writing a white paper for first merge mined sidechain
commitments.quote: Then writing a white paper for first merge mined sidechain.

commitments.commitment: Share first updates on sidechains development in coming weeks
commitments.quote: So for sidechains development, yeah, well, I will share first updates. Well, in the coming weeks, probably, we can start to do such things.

commitments.commitment: Explain sub-blocks design in coming weeks, maybe with videos
commitments.quote: So for sub-blocks I think, well, there is need to explain how it is designed and done for more, right? So we will do it in coming weeks, maybe with some videos.

commitments.commitment: Ship hard-baked machines to initial InfraDAO participants
commitments.quote: So for those people, I'm hard baking a machine, cloning it from the three machines that are running right now in the InfraDAO, and we'll ship them out.

commitments.commitment: GitCircles project specification will be published in coming days
commitments.quote: Actually, he has a specification done and it will be published in the coming days. He sent me a specification a few days ago.

commitments.commitment: Create easy tool for mining pools to pick merge mined sidechains
commitments.quote: Then there is need for some easy tool for mining puzzles, right? And we will do that. So it should be like UI, right? Where they just, pick chains they like and mine them along with them.
